title:
Cooper-pair splitters as circuit elements for realizing topological
  superconductors
authors:
Guilherme Delfino, Dmitry Green, Saulius Vaitiek\.enas, Charles M.
  Marcus, Claudio Chamon
abstract:
Advances in materials and fabrication of superconducting devices allows the
exploration of novel quantum effects in synthetic superconducting systems
beyond conventional Josephson junction arrays. As an example, we introduce a
new circuit element, the Y-splitter, a superconducting loop with three leads
and three Josephson junctions, smaller or comparable in size to the
superconducting coherence length of the material. By tuning magnetic flux
through an array of Y-splitters, Cooper-pair transport can be made to interfere
destructively, while spatially separated split Cooper pairs propagate
coherently. We consider an array of Y-splitters connected in a two-dimensional
star [Archimedean (3,$12^2$)] geometry, deformable into the kagome lattice, and
find a rich phase diagram that includes topological superconducting phases with
Chern numbers $\pm 2$. Experimental realization appears feasible.
